oai_dc:dc.dc:title: NUMERICAL SIMULATION OF STORM SURGES BY MULTI-LEVEL MODELS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Yamashita, Takao
Tsuchiya, Yoshito
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: surge
numerical simulation
multi-level model
surge model
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The numerical simulation of storm surges in shallow bays is investigated by multi-level models such as the 2-level and FE-FD models which are used to consider the velocity profiles in wind-induced currents. These models were applied to hindcast the storm surge caused by Typhoon 7916 in Osaka Bay with the result that the water surface elevations and currents induced by the storm surge were successfully simulated.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 19 (1984): Proceedings of 19th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Houston, Texas, 1984.; 12
